PositionProfile.PositionFormattedDescription:
Jake's Demo has been performing large, small and emergency services in our community for 35 years. Our plumbers and HVAC technicians are highly skilled and utilize the latest technologies in our industry! From emergency repairs to a major renovation, a small or large commercial, industrial or multi-family installation, we have the resources. Years of extensive experience, training and education enable us to keep your business flowing smoothly… 24/7. 

Call us at 515-555-5555 or stop by, we are located at 1309 Pennsylvania Ave., South Houston, TX 77587.  Office hours are Monday- Friday 8am - 5pm.

Company Benefits

  • $47-$52/hour
  • Company outings & parties, a great work environment and an awesome support team!
  • Tool purchase and replacement program
  • Boiler Training 
  • Smart phone & Tablet
  • On call pay
  • Paid Holidays and Vacation
  • A fully stocked vehicle to drive home, uniforms and laundry service
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • Long Term and Short Term Disability Coverage
  • Life Insurance
  • 401K with matching and vesting

We are currently seeking Construction Foreman to join our growing team!

Our company is GROWING and we are looking to add members to our production team.  Our company will provide extensive training to qualified applicants on the specific solutions we provide to our customers.  

We are looking for a hands-on foreman to be responsible for the installation of the company's egress window, waterproofing and foundation repair products according to quality standards, job specifications, and safety regulations. Our foremen work hard and get rewarded with excellent pay and benefits. Some travel is required.

Description: Lead the team installing waterproofing, crawlspace, egress windows, and foundation repair projects. 

Job Responsibilities

  • Install waterproofing, egress windows, foundation repair, and crawlspace products.
  • Discuss with customers the installation timeline and construction process.
  • Lead the loading and unloading of materials and tools. Distribute according to project plans.
  • Train and provide assistance to other workers and foreman as necessary.
  • Read and interpret plans, instructions, and specifications to determine work activities.
  • Operate all tools and equipment required to do each job. Care for these tools and equipment in order to ensure long lasting use.
  • Clean and prepare construction areas to eliminate possible hazards.
  • Ensure proper clean-up of all work areas after each job is complete.

Qualifications

  • Solid background in construction with a minimum of two years experience required.
  • Must be able to lift 75lbs
  • Class A driver’s license preferred or willingness to obtain licensure within first month of employment with company provided assistance.
  • A pre-employment drug screen and valid driver's license are required.
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

  • Company outings & parties, a great work environment and an awesome support team!

  • Boiler Training 
  • Smart phone & Tablet
  • On call pay
  • Paid Holidays and Vacation
  • A fully stocked vehicle to drive home, uniforms and laundry service
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • Long Term and Short Term Disability Coverage
  • Life Insurance
  • 401K with matching and vesting

We are currently seeking Construction Inspector to join our growing team!

 

Job Responsibilities

  • Performs technical inspections of construction work pursuant to applications filed with the Department of Buildings.
  • These applications involve the erection, alteration, and repair of structures throughout the city. The inspector is to determine if construction work is being done safely and in conformance with approved applications, plans, and specifications in accordance with the NYC Construction Code, Zoning Resolution, or other pertinent laws and rules enforced by the Department of Buildings.
  • Responds to, reports and investigates accidents, incidents and complaints for conformity with NYC Construction Codes, Department rules, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications.
  • Studies drawings to obtain details for inspections.
  • Issues violations, summonses and stop work orders.
  • Verifies licenses of onsite workers.
  • When issuing violations, advises the recipient of the nature of the violating condition.
  • Testifies as needed, including at ECB, depositions, and court.
  • Maintains records and makes reports.
  • Explains and enforces laws and rules relevant to the field.
  • May assign, supervise, review and evaluate work of subordinates.
  • May train subordinates in their duties.
  • May review applications relevant to the field.
  • May assist supervisor.
  • Operates a motor vehicle in the performance of assigned duties

Qualifications

  • Five years of full-time, satisfactory experience working in the construction trades as a carpenter, mason, ironworker, plasterer, architect, engineer, building construction superintendent, or inspector of building construction; or

  • A license as a professional engineer or registered architect issued pursuant to the New York State Education law; or

  • Three years of full-time, satisfactory experience as described in "1" above, and two years of formal training or education in an acceptable construction program, given in a college accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) or a technical school or trade school approved by a state’s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization; or

  • Three years of participation in the apprentice construction inspection program offered by the Department of Buildings, and either two years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in "1" above, or two years of formal training or education as described in "3" above.

  • Experience not considered acceptable: working as a home-improvement contractor (e.g., doing siding, roofing and painting), sheet metal worker, shipbuilder, metal lather, Sheetrock taper, glazier, insulation installer.

  • Driver License Requirement: At the time of appointment to this position, you must have a motor vehicle driver license valid in the State of New York. If you have moving violations, license suspension or an accident record, you may be disqualified. This license must be maintained for the duration of your employment.

Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

We are currently seeking Customer Service Representative to join our growing team!

 

Job Responsibilities

  • Inbound and outbound telephone and email outreach to current customers and follow up through resolution of issue tickets.
  • Contact clients with delinquent payments, expired and declined credit cards.
  • Respond to credit card disputes and third party customer service complaint sites/
  • General office administrative tasks- including FedEx, electronic filing and office supply ordering
  • Notate and update Salesforce and other databases with client interaction accurately
  • Follow up with vendors as needed to best serve clients
  • Assist sales representatives with trouble shooting and client follow up
  • Attend monthly meetings with management to review standard operating procedures and and status of collections as it pertains to the client services department

Qualifications

  • Enthusiastic: You are launching your career and have a passion for making our clients happy. We like treat our families as we would treat our own.
  • Analytical: You are detail-oriented and results-focused. Your strong suit is in positivity and problem solving. Success is found in making sense of a fast-paced, changing environment with a strong sense of prioritization and organization, allowing you to multi-task quickly and effectively.
  • Communicative: Possess professional phone and email etiquette. You are able to work effectively in a high volume and multitasking environment while maintaining accuracy.
  • Ready-to-go: Hustle. You use the tools of your world to manage operations effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment focused on quality. Bringing a can-do attitude and an eye for detail in our solutions-oriented environment is valued by the team.
  • YOU MUST have experience with software- Microsoft Office and Salesforce.
  • YOU MUST have experience taking payments, collecting on past due payments and making upset client happy.
  • Educated: Bachelor’s degree or significant experience equivalent.
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

We are currently seeking General Laborer to join our growing team!

 

Job Responsibilities

  • Mat Rolling - machine roll mats on a conveyor and place in storage
  • Mending - mending and patching garments; replacing hooks/snaps or zippers, repairing aprons and buttons
  • Soil 2 - sorting and counting soiled items
  • Stockroom 2 - general stocking and receiving, new order shipping, making label ID's, emblems and nametags, activate/close out A, B and C garments, and unloading skids
  • Sewing Stockroom - sewing emblems, hemming pants, mark, measure and rip pants, and sew emblems, and sleeve emblems
  • RTS - inspects merchandise received from a closed account
  • Autosort Plus - using the computer and sorting equipment to sort groups of clean garments

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma/GED
  • 0-2 years experience
  • Great work ethic and and can-do attitude
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

We are currently seeking HVAC Service Technician to join our growing team!

The HVAC Manager is responsible for servicing all system issues in a timely manner and to the customer's satisfaction. These specialists will be responsible for troubleshooting and repairing customer systems, performing scheduled maintenance on residential and commercial equipment, servicing and/or cleaning products/equipment on all residential and commercial job sites, and suggesting and performing system improvements, modifications, etc. to current customers.

This position has working conditions that may expose you to various weather conditions and require you to work outside normal working hours including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Job Responsibilities

  • Provide general HVAC installation, repair and maintenance services for various residential and commercial equipment types
  • Be polite and respectful to clients and their property
  • Good communication skills to be able interact with team members and customers
  • Ability to work independently
Qualifications
  • Journeyman certification preferred, but not required
  • 5 years experience in HVAC
  • High School Diploma/GED
  • Valid Iowa Driver’s License
  • Clean driving record
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

PositionProfile.PositionFormattedDescription:
Jake's Plumbing has been performing large, small and emergency services in our community for 35 years. Our plumbers and HVAC technicians are highly skilled and utilize the latest technologies in our industry! From emergency repairs to a major renovation, a small or large commercial, industrial or multi-family installation, we have the resources. Years of extensive experience, training and education enable us to keep your business flowing smoothly… 24/7. 

Call us at 515-555-5555 or stop by, we are located at 1309 Pennsylvania Ave., South Houston, TX 77587.  Office hours are Monday- Friday 8am - 5pm.

Company Benefits

  • $25-30.00 per hour
  • Company outings & parties, a great work environment and an awesome support team!
  • Tool purchase and replacement program
  • Boiler Training 
  • Smart phone & Tablet
  • On call pay
  • Paid Holidays and Vacation
  • A fully stocked vehicle to drive home, uniforms and laundry service
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • Long Term and Short Term Disability Coverage
  • Life Insurance
  • 401K with matching and vesting

We are currently seeking Licensed Journeyman/Master Plumbers to join our growing team!

Licensed Plumbing Technician

The Plumbing Technician is responsible for installing, repairing, and maintaining various plumbing fixtures, and piping used for potable water systems, and wastewater disposal in commercial and industrial buildings in a safe and professional manner.

Job Scope

  • Reports in by 8:00am M-F each day to receive first call. He is responsible for that call until it is completed.  The technician will fill out and complete his mobile ticket before he leaves the job with complete notes describing the job from start to finish.  The Technician will then complete the invoice before receiving the next job.
  • Complete all work in cooperation with dispatch, and be responsible for complete customer satisfaction. The Technician will communicate with customer before, during, and after job to keep them fully informed of the progress, necessary repairs, and obtain necessary approvals to do the work recommended. 
  • Communicate with dispatch any changes to work scope, additional time needed to perform the task, and provide an informed quote for any additional work using available technology provided.

Job Responsibilities

  • Drive safely to service calls.
  • Diagnose and provide suggestions on best way to approach the problem.
  • Maintain good customer service.
  • Identify required tools and safety equipment
  • Select the type and size of materials required
  • Install and/or repair as necessary for customer satisfaction
  • Test for leaks after each job.
  • Hand excavation to repair or install water and sewer lines
  • Backhoe excavation/operation and safety
  • Keep track of all parts used for each job and log on invoice.
  • Write estimates and invoices using technology provided
  • Maintain all building codes and required permits
  • Ensure all requirements as specified by manufacturer of systems are met.
  • Ensure all installations, repairs and maintenance are properly sized, aligned, supported and graded.
  • Ensure all installations, repairs and maintenance meet or exceed the requirements of appropriate jurisdictional codes.

Administrative Duties

  • Turn in a completed invoice with all materials and labor accurately accounted for.
  • Turn in neat and accurate time sheets by 9:00am Tuesday morning complete with dispatch number, job address, and hours worked for that job.  Any non-billable hours will be approved by supervisor and initialed on time sheets.
  • Report any repairs needed to company vehicles or equipment in a timely manner.
  • Turn in any excess materials from bid jobs to maintain proper truck inventory.
  • Maintain truck inventory at acceptable level.
  • Report any issues with company phones or tablets for repair.
  • Report and turn in any damaged uniforms for replacement.

Job Requirements

  • Must be a Licensed Journeyman and/or Master Plumber
  • Must have a current and valid driver's license with a clean driving record
  • Offers are contingent upon the successful completion and satisfactory results of a drug and background check
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.

We are currently seeking Pipefitter to join our growing team!

Trillium Construction is currently seeking Apprentice and Journeyman Pipefitters to fit steel, galvanized, copper, copper-nickel, and stainless pipes, along with the appropriate valves and fittings in accordance with drawings, arrangements and blueprints. We offer stable work, a competitive wage, and benefits to those who qualify! There is no per diem offered for this position.

Qualifications
  • Apprentices must have 2 years of work experience and licensed in MN.
  • Journeyman must have a State of MN License.
  • Ability to layout, fabricate, fit, and install various products.
  • Able to read and understand blueprints.
  • A valid driver’s license.
  • Reliable transportation.
  • Own basic hand tools.
  • Able to use ladders and scaffolding to perform installations.
  • Ability to pass pre-employment screenings.
Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.
